children.value: manages the creation and caching of programs. It allows the application to request a program based on a vertex shader, fragment shader and set of defines, modules and code injections. The

will return the requested program, creating it the first time, and re-using a cached version if it is requested more than once. It also allows for the definition of hook functions and module code injections to be inserted into shaders.
// Will be included in all following programs
// Basic, no defines, only default module
// Cached, same as program 1, use count 2
// New program, with different source based on define
// New program, with different source based on module and its injection
// Cached, same as program 4, use count 2
// Cached program still available, use count 1
// Cached program still available, use count 1
Get a program that fits the parameters provided. If one is already cached, return it, otherwise create and cache a new one.
constants to include in the shaders.
: Array of module objects to include in the shaders.
: Object of hook injections to include in the shaders.
Add a module that will automatically be added to any programs created by the program manager.
Remove a module that is automatically being added to programs created by the program manager.

properties.ariaLabel: code classlanguage textaddshaderhookhook  string opts  objectcode permalink

children.value: Creates a shader hook function that shader modules can injection code into. Shaders can call these functions, which will be no-ops by default. If a shader module injects code it will be executed upon the hook function call. This mechanism allows the application to create shaders that can be automatically extended by included shader modules.
followed by the name and arguments of the function, e.g.

. Hook name without arguments
will also be used as the name of the shader hook
(optional): code always included at the beginning of a hook function
(optional): code always included at the end of a hook function
Returns an object containing all the uniforms defined for the program. Returns
Indicate that a program is no longer in use. When all references to a program are released, the program is deleted.
